S.FORM: tanek kamo!
akokey a sinsi namen.
lisna kamo.
akokey kamo, o ko ipanci sicyarow ya ciriciring no tao am, kanekanen.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的達悟語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today I’m going to teach you how to say food in Tao.

S.FORM: mo katenngan ko ipanci?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what I’m saying?

S.FORM: ko jiatenngi, apya ipisa mo pa ipanci?
S.TRANSL: 我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it?

S.FORM: makaciak ka, ta ko jia mizing?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: cita do jia! tobwohen mo o ciring ko.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: yapiya mo nivilangan.
ipisa pa,makaciak ka.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: ji kamo manilo.
ahap o vakong mo.
noon apen ko.
ahap o ipeyvatvatek mo.
ko nikahamangan o ipeyvatvatek ko.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: ahapen mo o ipangongopas.
ko nikahamangan o ipangongopas ko.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: vood pa do katangked mo o ipangongopas na.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: vooden ko pa o ipangongopas mo an?
meywalam tamo pa.
maminda do jia o pacinanaoan niyo.
sino ka?
Si Masarey ko.
sino ka?
yaken am, si Masarey ko, anak nyaman Somakey.
S.TRANSL: 我是syaman Somakey的兒子，我叫si Masarey。
I am the son of syaman Somakey, my name is si Masarey.

S.FORM: sino ka?
si Masarey ko, yamnanao jiyaken am, syaman Mateneng.
S.TRANSL: 我是syaman Matenen的學生，我叫si Msarey。
I am a student of syaman Matenen, my name is si Msarey.

S.FORM: sino o ngaran mo?
O ngaran ko am, si Masarey.
sino ngaran ni ama mo?
ngaran ni ama am, syaman Somakey.
S.TRANSL: My father’s name is Syaman somakey.

S.FORM: sino ito?
si Matopos.
si kaka ko ori. si Matopos.
S.TRANSL: 他是我的哥哥，他叫si Matopos。
He’s my brother, his name is si Matopo.

S.FORM: sino o ngaran na?
o ngaran na am, si Matopos.
o ngaran na am, si Monot?
S.TRANSL: 他的名字是, si Monot嗎?

S.FORM: nonan, ngaran na si Manaik.
S.TRANSL: 是，他的名字是 si Manaik。
Yes, his name is si Manaik.

S.FORM: ngaran na am, si Manaik?
beken, o ngaran na am, si Matopos.
S.TRANSL: No, his name is si Matopos.

S.FORM: sino ori?
si kaminan sinan Maomey.
S.TRANSL: She is sinan Maomey. she is my aunt.

S.FORM: sino ito?
si kavakes, si Mangato.
S.TRANSL: She is my friend and her name is si Mangato.

S.FORM: yapira kakawakawan mo?
ya asa ngarnan o kakawakawan ko.
yapira kakawakawan na?
ya adowa o ikarwa no kakawakawan na.
yapira kakawakawan ni ama mo?
ya lima ngarnan o kakawakawan ni ama.
kamo papira meyketeketeh?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: yararwa sira kaka, yasa si wari.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: yamyan si kaka mo a mahakey?
jiabo a.
kamo papira do vahey nyo?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: namen apapat.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: do anjin mo peyvatvatkan?
do Taitong.
sino ori?
simaran.
ikongo na vazey nimaran mo?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: mikalsong
sino o ito?
Sikaka a mavakes.
ikongo na vazey nikaka mo a mavakes?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: ya meyvazey do koysang
meyketeketeh sira ori?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: beken, sira am meykagagan.
yanjoming ka?
nan, tao ko.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I am a member of the Tao tribe.

S.FORM: yanjoming o kahanghangan mo?
nan, am peynan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, but she is a Puyuma.

S.FORM: yamakarang si ama mo?
nan, namen makakarang a yasa ka vahey.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: ya na meyvatvatek si wari mo a mavakes?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: nan, ya na meyvatvatek.
ya mateneng sira wari mo do ciriciring no tao?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: nan, sira mateng do ciriciring no tao.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: kamo papira meyketeketeh?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: namen tatlo a meyketeketeh.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: ka macivahey do inyapoan mo?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: nan, Ko macivahey do inyapoan ko.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: ka macivahey da akes mo?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: jibo a, ko jimacivahey jira.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: sino ma pacivahayan?
sira yama kani ina kani kaka a mahakey.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: do anjin mo nikapoan?
ko nimapo do Taitong.
do anjin mo peyvahayan?
ko meyvahey do Taitong.
do anjin o pongso nyo.
do Irala.
S.TRANSL: My hometown is in Orchid Island.

S.FORM: Do anjin o ili nyo?
Namen meyili do Jiraraley.
S.TRANSL: Our tribe is in Long Island Village.

S.FORM: simanngo am,ka mangey do ili nyo?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: simeywalam do peyvatvatkan do teyteyka.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: kanakan ko do pongso.
manngo kakawan sicyarow ya?
yamasilag, yamangannget.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: yamarekmeh do pantow?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: yamarekmeh, pakaroen mo o ayob mo.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: yamangannget do pantow?
jiabo a,yamarekmeh ta ya somazowsow.
manngo kakawan sicyarow ya?
yapiya ta yajiarekmeh a yajimangannget.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: manngo kakawan simahep?
yabo cinalab,yamyan so mata no anit.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: manngo kakawan do pantow?
nakangan pa,yamyan so silag,a neyiyan no nanirang.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: manngo do dang o kakawan?
S.TRANSL: What's the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: yamapagpag do jia.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: manngo do dang o kakawan?
yapiya,rako a silage.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: mangey ko na do peyvatvatkan.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: Pakaroen mo o ayob mo,ta yamarekmeh.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: makowbot ko nan.
paloloen mo o payong mo, ta sitai am yamacimoy.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: ya macimoy?
nimeykadey, sitai am macimoy ori.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: nimacimoy?
nimacimoy,am yana nimangan.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: nimacimoy?
yakmey nimacimoy,ta yamavasa o rarahan.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: nimacimoy?a mo ka vasa no kataotao?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: nimacimoy do pantow, ko jia nimapalolo so paying ko.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: kapya a?
teymapagpag,yameyngen oo ko a nikasazowsawan.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: kapya a?
yatey rako silag,a ko ikaood.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: ko jia nipalolo o peyvatvatek ko
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: vooden mo jiaken
ko jia nipalolo o sosopit ko
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: ko akman sang a jia nimapalolo sya,mangey ta manazang
S.TRANSL: I don't have one either, let's go buy one.

S.FORM: mangey ta manazang so peyvatvatek ta?
S.TRANSL: Let's go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: noon, kano pangongopas
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: mangey ta manazang so aryagen ta?
S.TRANSL: Let's go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: tosya, ta ko na nikoman do vahey namen.
S.TRANSL: No, I've already eaten at home.

S.FORM: ko jia nimanakem o otwan ko a azidangdangen.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: angey azidangdang pa!
ko jia nimanakem o otwan ko a paloloen
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: kanen ta o otwan ko
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let's eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: ikongo o yagza mo?
S.TRANSL: What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: ko magza do peyvatvatkan.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: ikongo o kanen mo simararow?
S.TRANSL: What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: o ko nipalolo a otwan ko sicyarow ya am, yagza ta.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I've brought a lunchbox today, let's eat together at noon!

S.FORM: apiya ka peybozo ta mapakozong so bozo?
S.TRANSL: Let's go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: mangey ta
apiya ka peybozo ta manipzot so bozo?
taosya, ta meyvilang pa so vakong.
inya pa o vivyas sang.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: apey, apen mo ya.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here's a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: inya pa o zamit ang?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: ko mivyas,panci mo si Pavinen ta mahap sya itoro jimo.
S.TRANSL: 我在掃地，你叫si Pavinen幫你拿。
I'm sweeping the floor, so ask si Pavinen to carry it for you.

S.FORM: mo na nivyasan?
ko na nivyasan.
ka ji mivyas?
ko na teyka nivyasan.
yamalolit o teyrahem,linasan mo pa.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: noon.mangey ko apen o zamit a ilinas jia
yamalolit o pazezevngen, ,linasan mo pa.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: siteypa, ta ko pa mivyas.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I'm not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: sitwai am,ikongo o vazey mo?
ko kalahen o sinsi namen.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: simeysyasyey am,ikongo o vazey mo?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: namen mangey meyyanoanood ka no kagagan ko.
S.TRANSL: I'm going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: simeysyasyey am,ikongo o vazey na?
ya mangey meyyawawat.
yamyan si Namet do vahey da?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if si Namet is at home?

S.FORM: yamyan do sahad,asdep jia.
yamyan si Namet do vahey da?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if si Namet is at home?

S.FORM: yabo,ikongo mo kala an sya?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: sino ka?
akey, si Mapapo ko, iwangan mo pa.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I am si Mapapo, please open the door.

S.FORM: sino ka?
mo Tanangen,yaken am,si Masarey.ko kalahen imo a kayalalam ko.
S.TRANSL: Tanangen，我是si Masarey，我來找你玩了。
Tanangen, I am si Masarey and I have come to play with you.

S.FORM: ka mowney a jia nimacita.
nonan,ko ikasinalow imo,ai jia ta meykawalam ta.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

S.FORM: lisna jito,apey ayopen mo a asoy no anyoy.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and drink coconut water.

S.FORM: ayoy
apey ayopen mo a asoy no anyoy..
asyo asoy no anyoy ya,yatey apiya so keyyopan.
koman ta so somon!
jiaraheta!asyo o rarako a somon ya.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些大西瓜看起來很棒。
Yes! These big watermelons look great.

S.FORM: yapiya nakakanan no somon?
yatey apiya.
ya na nimanengdeng so yoyab ta si ina,mai ka jia koman.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: mavanow ko pa.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: jikasnek a koman,mo matarek yamen.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

S.FORM: ko mabsoy,ta yaro ko nyakan.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: akan pa,jikasnek.
yapiya kanen.
mangey ko na,sipisa am mai ko a tomita jimo.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: noon, sipisa am mai ka a tomita jiaken.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come see me next time.

S.FORM: mangey ko na do vahey namen, ta yamahep rana.
sipisa am mai ka a maci peyyalalam jiaken.
makapya ka.
noon,no abo vazey mo am, mai ka do ta meyyalalam ta.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: akokey kamo, ko yangey inyo a maciwalam do rarakeh.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m going to take you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: yapiya, ta ipacisirisiring namen do rarakeh so ciriciring no tao.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說達悟語。
Great! We’re going to talk to the seniors with Tao.

S.FORM: ta mo na makaranes?
yamakeykai rana.
akey kong,namen panangangey imo.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: sira apo kong, ayoy ta mai kamo do jia, kamo mateneng do ciriciring no tao.
S.TRANSL: 你們會說達悟語啊!真是太棒了!
You guys can speak Tao! That’s great!

S.FORM: akokey kamo, ko yangey inyo a mamoong do kadai.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我今天要帶大家去小米田除草。
Hello, I’m going to take you to the millet field for weeding today.

S.FORM: noon.
malovot kamo do jia, manakem nyo o ipamoong nyo a paloloen.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: noon. ya namen rana nipalolo o ipamoong namen.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: simanngo am makaranes ta?
jiarai pa.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: mangey mo taktakan.
noon,mangey ko taktakan.
apey o ipanvoyow so lacyow ang.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: noon,voyaoen ko o lacyow.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: akokey kamo,mangey ta manita so aro a omowmalalam.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: jiaraheta! makongo tamo a mangey do dang?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: mavang tamo do aleleh.
matoatonton kamo do jia, ta manazang ta so kippo ta.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: noon.
do sazapen ta am aro a meyyasasalap, do ta likodan am aro a voley. nakenakem nyo a meylingalingey.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: ko ikanyahey o voley.
cyaha ta manita ka so meyyasasalap.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: asa ka vatvatek o icita nyo sya,kai nyo malovot do jiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: ayoy. namen isarey jimo a sinsi namen.
ikongo mo nimacita sicyarow ya.
yaro ko nimacita voley kano meyyasasalap.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: makaksez kamo, ta mangey ta rana.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: siteypa, ta yamazikna o ai ko.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: mangey tamo meyyawawat?
noon! mangey tana!
ya teyyaro yameyyawawat do jia.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: yamarahem do jito, totangyan jia meyyawawat.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: ka nimakong a nimai jia?
ko niomalam.
ikongo mo niavangan a aleleh?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: avavangan no tao a rako a aleleh.
ka nimakong a nimangey do Kyokay?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: na nyavang yaken ni ama,meyheza mangey.
ya makongo a yamangey do peyvatvatkan da?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: ya na iyavang ni ama na do otobay.
S.TRANSL: 他爸爸用摩托車載去學校。
His father drove him to school on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: yamakongo si akes mo a yamey manazang so iyakan?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: ya meyotobay a yamey manazang so iyakan.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: makongo ka a mangey do pongso?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: mavang ko do avang a mangey do pongso.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: makongo ito a mangey do pongso?
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: mavang do sikoki a mangey do pongso.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: makongo ito a mangey do Kawsyong?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: mavang do yamangonong do vahalang a aleleh a mangey do kawsyong.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: ya mavang do yamatolatolang a aleleh a mangey do Taitong?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: nonan, ya mavang do yamatolatolang a aleleh a mangey do Taitong
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: ya nimavang do yamatolatolang a aleleh a mangey do Taitong?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: beken, ni mavang do sikoki a mangey do Taitong.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: yamyan so masngen do jia pananalan so aleleh?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: Jingyan, tokamangonong ta paka citan mo so pananalan so aleleh.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: ya masngen do jia o minato?
S.TRANSL: Is the port very close to here?

S.FORM: jiarai do jiya o minato a.
S.TRANSL: The port is far away from here.

S.FORM: no yamavangan do avavangan no tao a rako a aleleh am, ya mowney a yamakaranes do peyvatvatkan nyo?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: yasa ka vatvatek a na ka pakaranes do peyvatvatkan namen.
S.TRANSL: 一個小時會到我們學校。
Come to our school one hour.

S.FORM: no yamavangan do yamangonong do vahalang a aleleh a mangey do Taipey am, yapira ka vatvatek.
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺北?
How long does it take to get to Taipei by THSR?

S.FORM: yadowa ka vatvatek a na ka pakaranes do Taipey.
S.TRANSL: We will arrive Taipei in two hours.

S.FORM: yamowney o mo peyaleleh a yamangey do Olay?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: ala yasa ka vatvatek.
simlivon ka mai do vahey namen am mowney?
S.TRANSL: 你環島走路來我家要多久?
How long does it take for you to walk from the island to my house?

S.FORM: atlo a kavatvatek.
Ka mateneng do yavaziososen no ai a meyyaleleh?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: Ko mateneng do yavaziososen no ai a meyyaleleh.
yamyan so otobay mo?
yasa o otobay ko.
ka mateneng a ya meyotobay?
yabo otobay ko.
apiya o kapacici ko jimo?
jiapiya, Ko apiyaen,
apiya o kapacici ko jimo?
taosya, ta yapereh ko katenngan.
S.TRANSL: Don't, I don't know much about it.

S.FORM: yamya so vazey mo simakoyab? ko ikakza ko kangey jimo a pacicien.
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I'd like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: jiapiya, nanalahen ko imo do vahey namen.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I'll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: yamya so vazey mo simarow? ko pacicien imo do kavavatanen no tao.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於達悟族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I'd like to ask you about the legendary story of the Tao tribe.

S.FORM: ko mangey do takey simarow. ori ko jingyani do vahey namen.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I'm going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won't be home.

S.FORM: ko mammyamizing am, yaro ko no mo katenngan a iwawalam no tao.ipanci mo jiaken an.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對達悟族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you know a lot about the traditional customs of the Tao tribe, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: yapereh ko katenngan, o katenngan ko o ononongan ko an.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don't know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: apiya o ka siva ko jimo? ta jiko ngawawi niya.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: jiapiya, ikongo salit na.
yapira o kakawakawan mo?
yasyam a ngarnan rana o kakawakawan ko.
ka malavayo pa.
tomancian! ko na rarakeh.
do anjin mo nikapoan?
ko nimapo do Jiraraley.
tao do pongso o mavakes mo?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是達悟族人嗎?
Is your wife a member of the Tao tribe?

S.FORM: Beken, ta bonong o mavakes ko.
sino mo katenngan so ciriciring?
ko katenngan o ciriciring da no amis kano peynan.
S.TRANSL: 我會說阿美語和卑南語。

S.FORM: ko masarey a yamakamizing so mo ipanci, pancian pala o makanyow do among no rayon?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關飛魚禁忌好嗎?
It's a pleasure to interview you today, can you tell us about the flying fish taboo?

S.FORM: yapiya. no kalavayo ko pa am, masanib ko a manawaz so alibangbang.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常捕撈飛魚。
Yes. When I was young, I used to catch a lot of flying fish.

S.FORM: ayoy mo ninanao jiaken sicyarow ya. ya teyapiya.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: yabo do dang o yamalas a ko nipanci. a vahavahangsowen da ononongan no ineynapo namen.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，我們祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of our ancestors have been handed down.

S.FORM: maminda do jia o pacician ko jimo sicyarow ya. ayoy mo nipanci.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That's all for today's interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: mo kamoan niyaken. no ipisa am, malavat ta.
mangey ko rana an, inaoy no aroaro pa o mamizing ko sipisa kai ko.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I'm going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: noon! makapya ka an.
akokey, ikongo mo sazangan?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: ko manazang so koppo.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: akokey, ikongo mo sazangan?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what do you want to buy?

S.FORM: ko manazang so sakop.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: ko manazang so koppo, ya miyan?
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: jingyan a, yapira mo sazangan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: kamo manazang no mamahen?
yabo, namen jimanazang no mamahen.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.

S.FORM: ko manazang so mojis.
yapira mo sazangan?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: yatlo a lavat.
ko manazang so wakey.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: da na nimimin o wakey a nisazangan.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: ko manazang so adoa aneng.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: yasa ka tagow rana o aneng a yamavezed.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: panazang mo yaken so icyoy.
yapira mo sazangan?
S.TRANSL: How many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: apira mo sazangan a icyoy?
S.TRANSL: How many eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: ko manazang so anem.
ko manazang so adoa bedbed a nappa.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two handfuls of cabbage.

S.FORM: yatlo a bedbed rana o yamapanpan.to mo na mimina apen.
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: yapira o ngina no mojis ya?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: yasa lavat am, yadoa poo.
yasa neykatlo a ngarnan, adoa ngarnan am.
ayoy.
ya mian jia so yalima so ipakapoo.
to ko na nganeta asa poo o sazangan ko.
S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: nakalovotan am,yasangarnan neykanem a poo.
apiya ka alima na poo no itoro ko?
yatey masingat oya, apiya pahephepan mo?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: taosya, ta yapereh rana nginginan sya.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: ko manazang so yasakekeh a okasi.
S.TRANSL: I want this bag of candy.

S.FORM: yatlo a nganan o ngina no okasi.yapa mian so mo ikakza ya sazangan?
S.TRANSL: 這糖果30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for this candy, anything else you need?

S.FORM: apiya ka pamood ko pa jimo so nizpi?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: jiapiya! yapira mo apen a nizpi?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: ko nikahamangan o nizpi ko. apiya ka pamood ko pa jimo so nizpi?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: apiya ori do ko jia nimapalolo so nizpi!
S.TRANSL: I don't have any money either!

S.FORM: ko nikahamangan o nizpi ko. apiya ka pamood ko pa jimo so nizpi?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: taosya, ta mo jianipaoli pa o nivood mo jiaken a nizpi.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven't paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: apiya ka vood ko so talili mo?
jiapiya. ahap do dang.
apiya ka vood ko so vakong mo?
ko na nitoro ji Masarey a na vooden.
S.TRANSL: I lent it to si Masarey.

S.FORM: vooden ko pa o tagzezeng mo an?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的眼鏡好嗎?
Can I borrow your glasses, please?

S.FORM: ahap,simarow am, paolien mo jiaken.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: yamacimoy, ko jianipalolo o payong ko, vooden ko pa o payong mo an?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It's raining, I don't have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.FORM: yasa o payong ko, key! oya payong ta!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let's stick together!

S.FORM: oya nivood ko jimo a vakong,ko paolien jimo.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: simian so ikakza mo a citahen a vakong am,ipanci mo jiaken.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: simanngo am, paolien ko jimo o nizpi?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: cyaham! simian rana so nizpi mo am.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn't matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: simanngo am, paolien mo nizpi ko?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: simarow am, toro ko jimo.
S.TRANSL: I will return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: simanngo am, paolien mo vakong ko?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: no kakyab am nipaoli ko na jimo asyo?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn't I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: nipavood na jimo o ipeyvatvatek ya ni Mateneng?
S.TRANSL: 這支筆是si Mateneng借你的嗎?
Did si Mateneng lend you this pen?

S.FORM: nan, ko nivood jia sicyarow ya.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: ni vood mo o ipeyvatvatek ya ji Mateneng?
S.TRANSL: 這支筆是你跟si Mateneng借的嗎?
Did you borrow this pen from si Mateneng?

S.FORM: beken,oya am, na nisazangan ni ina.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: yabo rana o asin, mangey ka mangap so asin ji Maomey.
S.TRANSL: 沒有鹽了，去跟si Maomey拿點鹽。
No more salt, go get some salt from si Maomey.

S.FORM: noon, mangey ko mangap.
pancian si Maomey ta paolien na o nizpi ko.
S.TRANSL: Go tell si Maomey to give me my money back.

S.FORM: yapira na nivood jimo a nizpi?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: do anjin mo angayan?
ko mangey do ko peymowamowan.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: ikongo vazey mo do dang?
ya matamek, ko meycibciban, ka taktak ko jia no ranom.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There's too much grass, I'm cutting it, I'll have to water it later.

S.FORM: yai mo do jia o kekezdas kano sosoro an?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: do anjin mo nipangayan sya.
ko nipangey do katangked no vahalang.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the bar.

S.FORM: mo na nisorosoro?
S.TRANSL: Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: ko ka sorosoro pa sya, sitai am ko mowan.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: o mo nimowa wakey am, apiya rana kotden?
S.TRANSL: 你種的地瓜葉可以摘收了嗎?
Are your sweet potato leaves ready to harvest?

S.FORM: do jia o omaom am apiya rana kotden, o voong no wakey am,jipangotda.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的山蘇可以收成了，那裡的地瓜葉就還不能收成。
Here the sorrel is ready to harvest, but there the leaves of the gourds are not yet ready to harvest.

S.FORM: wa! asyo o mo nikali a yateyaro a wakey ang.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: pakozongen mo do yala ko an?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me put it in the back basket?

S.FORM: ikongo vazey nyo?
namen meytawaz.
S.TRANSL: We're releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: yaro jia o among?
yaro namen nitawazan.
S.TRANSL: 網裡裡已經抓了很多魚。
There's been a lot of fish caught in the net.

S.FORM: ikong mo ipangahahap?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: ko mamaltog so among.
S.TRANSL: I always shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: ka mateneng a mamaltog so vozow do kahasan?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: ko acingen sira yalittan, no yatatasa am, ko mangap so paoben mapalolo so ino.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: raharahan ya no korang.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: ikongo mo paka tenngan jia?
oya am,raharahan no korang,a rarahan ya no korang.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: angey pala cita o vavacing ta, yakmey nimaka vacing so korang.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: mo paka tenngan jia?
na nimahangno no ino, makaksez ta mangey.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let's follow them.

S.FORM: ikongo mo parngen ang?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: ko alpidan no vato o vavacing,a manakep so karam.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: ikongo mo pangain do dang?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: ori am vavacing a irakep so kagling.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羊。
That's a legged rope trap that we use to catch goats.

S.FORM: isarey ta do ineynapo ta, ta yaro tanimahap a omowmalalam do kahasan.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: nonan! moli ta na. tomaid do apapnan ta, a amvonong sya jiaten.
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let's take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: Ko nanaon inyo no omow malalam do ciriciring no tao.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的雅美語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Tao language today.

S.FORM: Ko nanaon inyo no kayokayo do ciriciring no tao.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的雅美語怎麼說。

S.FORM: Ko nanaon inyo no asyasi no kayokayo do ciriciring no tao.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的雅美語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Tao language today.

S.FORM: jika ngitkeh.
jika manilo.
ji kangan so tozatoza.
apen mo ovakong mo.
apen mo o ipeyvatvatek mo.
apen mo o mo peyveyvatvat kan.
pavokahenmo o vakong mo.
pavokahenmo o ipey vatvatek mo.
kozongenmo o kanen mo.
pavokahenmo o iyalalam mo.
sino o ipey vatvatek ya?
yaken nori.
sino vakong eya?
Si mateneng ori.
sino ipangongopas eya?
ko jyatenngi.
ayob na ori ni zociang?
beken, oyam patapilen na ayob.
mo sinsi, ko jyani mapalolo so vakong.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: cita do katangked mo.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: ni mavaci o ko ipey vatvatek.
pamood do kararey mo.
ko na jya kala o ipangongopas ko.
vood o ipangongopas ko.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: tamona meysyasey, meypepezat ka do rarahan simoli ka.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: noon, ayoi mo sinsi.
tamona mey syasey, meytamonan.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: mo sinsi, mey namen ranan.
akokey kamo, ngaran ko am, si mazonos.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is mazonos.

S.FORM: akokey mo mazonos.
akokey kamo, ngaran ko am, si zomakzak.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is zomakzak.

S.FORM: akokey mo zomakzak.
akokey, yaken am si arow.
akokey mo arow, yaken am si mareng.
akokey, yaken am si tomalilis.
akokey mo tomalilis, yaken am si somengha.
sino ka?
yaken am, ina ni mankeran. yaken am si manirey.
sino ka?
yaken am, si warina nimankeran, o ngaran ko am sitaim.
S.TRANSL: 我是warina的妹妹，我的名字是sitaim。
I am warina’s sister. My name is sitaim.

S.FORM: sinori?
iyam, sinsi ko, ngaran na am, si maskad.
sino ito?
si kaka ori, ngaran na am, si meykali.
iyam, si meykali?
noon, si meykali ori.
i mo am si meykali?
beken, yaken am si manhatow.
sino si manhatow?
yaken si manhatow.
sino si manhatow?
si manhatow am kagagan ko.
sino ngaran ni kaka mo a mavakes
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: ngaran ni kaka mavakes am si manirey.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is manirey.

S.FORM: ikong ngaran ni wari mo a mavakes?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: ngaran ni wari a mavakes am si mownownoten.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is mownownoten.

S.FORM: moka tenngan o ngaran na?
ngaran na am si meysako.
ya pira kaka wa kawan ni kaka mo?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: ya lima oyciar wa na.
ya pira kaka wa kawan ni wari mo?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: ya lima kaka wa kawan na.
yamyan do ilinyo so peyvatvatkan?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: yamyan.
kamyan do ilinyo ayamey vatvatek?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: noon, namen akmey asa ka vahey.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: sino o mahakey ito?
si maran nori.
sino o mavakes ito?
si kaka ori a mavakes.
sino kanakan ito?
si wari a mahakey.
ikongo o vazey na ni ina mo?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: ya meyvazey do cyokok.
ikongo o vazey ni yama mo?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: manga nanao.
si wari mo ori a mahakey?
beken, wari na no kagagan ni wari.
S.TRANSL: 不是， 他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: si kaka mo ri a mavakes?
beken, iyam si wari a mavakes.
S.TRANSL: 不是， 她是我的妹妹。
No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: sira papira do vahey da?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: sira la lima do vahey da.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: ya papira o anak do vahey nyo?
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: ya papat o anak namen.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: sira papira wari mo?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: yabo wari ko a mahakey, am ya tatlo wari ko a mavakes.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: sira papira o kaka mo?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: yabo o kaka ko.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: kamo papira meyketeketeh?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: yabo o kakteh ko.
kamo meyketeh ang?
noon, si kaka mahakey ori.
inyo am yancomin?
noon, yamen am yancomin.
iya am tao do pongso?
noon, tao ri do pongso.
yakman so ajin o kakawan si ciarow ya?
yakmey marekmeh, minomka so cinwat.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: yakman so anjin o kakawan si ciarow ya?
ya mangan nget, minomka so ranom.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: manngo do pantow o kakawan?
yarako arow, ji mongawawan o kapey koris mo so aneng.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: manngo do pantow o kakawan?
yaro o cinalab, yabo o arow.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: manngo simarow o kakawan?
simarow am, yabo o arow, yaro o cinalab, yarako sazowsow.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: do arow na am, jya tenngi o kakawan?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: do arow na am marekmeh, si makowbotka am mapatapil ka so talili mo.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: do i peywalam am, jya tenngi o kakawan?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: do i peywalam am, apiya o kakawan.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: do arow nonang am macimooy?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: do arow na am apiya o kakawan, ta yajya cimoy.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: do arow nonang am macimooy?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: noon, do arow na am macimoy.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: ya macimoy sicia ikoa ya?
ya na mangan, ya na meytotow o arow.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: ya macimoy sicia ikoa ya?
ya macimoy, ko jinipalolo o payong.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: ya macimoy do pantow?
ya jyacimoy sicia ikoa ya, si maligan o arow am macimoy, ma palolo ka so payong si makowbot ka.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: marekmeh sicia mina?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: noon, marekmeh sicia myan sawan, pakaroon mo o ayobmo.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: mangannget siciawan do teytey ka?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: noon, mangannget, aroo inomen mo aranom.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: mo ikakza o rayyon?
ko ikakza o rayyon, tayapiya o kakawan.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: mo ikakza o masngen do amyan?
ko jyakzan go panoyo toyon, ta aroo angin.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: ko nya ow ko ka palolo so vakong.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: citahen ta.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: ko nya ow ko ka palolo so ipangongopas.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: pavooden ko jimo.
monya ow ipivatvatek mo?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: noon, vooden ko pa oipeyvatvatek mo an?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: ikongo mo kanen si mararow?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: ko koman so nikates da odong.
ikongo mo kanen si makoyab?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: ko koman so mojis.
ikongo mo nyakan no kapnezak?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: ko nikoman so icyoi.
ikongo mo nyakan no kamararow?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: ko nikoman so manok.
mangey ta mapatoktok so bozo.
pan ma, sitoai am kalahen ko imo.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: mangey ta meyyawawat.
noon! meyheza ta mangey.
mangey ta meybozo.
taosya, ko mangey mangakot so vakong.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: kanani meyveravera so ngepen?
yabopa, ta komeyveravera so paney.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: monani oya san ngoso mo?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: ko nani oyasan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: ka nanimey veravera so paney?
ko nateyka ni vera o paney.
asyo ka jya ni mavanow?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: sitai mavanow ko.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: ikongo vazey mo no kacitoai?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: ko mangey kalahen o sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: ikongo mo vazey simey syasey kamo?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: ko to mey toposamoli.
ikongo na vazey simey syasey kamo?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: ya mangey maganam.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: maneyran, kamyan do vaheynyo?
komyan, asdepey.
maneyran, kamyan do vahaynyo?
yabo simaneyran, yaken nam, si ladang, yamyan so vazey mo? simai am, ipanci ko jya.
S.TRANSL: maneyran不在家耶!我是ladang，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告maneyran。
maneyran is not at home. I am ladang. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: sino kamo?
akes, yamen am si maneyran kani ladang.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是maneyran和ladang，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are maneyran and ladang, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: sino ka?
yaken am si magaga, ko kalahen si tomayo.
S.TRANSL: I am magaga, I am here for tomayo.

S.FORM: akes, ko maia tomita jimo.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: ka mow neyranaya jya ni mai, ko ikapow imo.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: manpang, ko kalahen imo amey yalalam.
S.TRANSL: manpang, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: asdeprana, ko mowney ya am nanlajimo.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: oya nimowa koa wakey, akan pala!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: ya maganinam o wakey.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: sijya! oya nimowa ko asomon, akan pala.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的西瓜，吃看看。
Come here! This is the watermelon I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: ya maganinam o somon.
lisna jito! oya nimo wa koa tomozokosi, akan pala!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: ow! yapiya kakanan na.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: koman ka so vazacinok.
ko jyangan so vazacinok, koman ko so asi no kayo.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: koman ka so o ka si?
noon, ko ikakey ori.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: atjipan ko o asi no kayo ta kanen mo.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: ayoi, yaroo asoy no asi no kayo.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: mangapko so ranom ta yopen mo.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: ayoi.
pakaroonmo o kanen mo, ta yaroo ko ni dengdenga yakan.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: ow! manoyong a yamaangno yapiya so kakanan.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: pakaroonmo o kanen mo, ta yaro pa dojya.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: ko na jyamo!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: pakaroonmo o kanen mo, ta yaro pa dojya.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: jikonangan, ta yarorana ko nyakan.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: na palolon yaten no sinsi a mangey do takey.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: maniring si ina am yaroo do takey o manongit.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: na palolon yaten no sinsi a mangey do kowran.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: tamo mangey mangavas?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: tamo mangey do jino?
na palolon yaten no sinsi a mangey do oyo.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: tamo mangey do jino siciaro oy ya?
na palolon yaten no sinsi a mangey do takey.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: tamo mangey do oyo siciarow ya?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: beken, na palolon yaten no sinsi a mangey do takey.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: tamo mangey do takey siciaro oy ya?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: beken, tamo mangey do kowran.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: mo sinsi, ikongo tamo mangey citahen do oyo?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: tamo mangey manita so poney.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: mo sinsi, ikongo tamo mangey citahen do takey?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: tamo mangey manita so pahapahad no anito.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: tamo mangey jino do kowran?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: tamo mangey citahen o ko nimowa tomozokosi.
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米。
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields.

S.FORM: mo sinsi, tamo mangey meyyawawat do oyo?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: beken, tamo mangey manita so poney.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: mo sinsi, tamo mangey meymowa so napa do kowran?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: tamo mangey pey valyaten o tana.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: yamya do dang so yatomelem a poney.
ko kapaka citapa so yamaviey a poney.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: yamyan dang so ya tomelem ma pahapahad no anito.
wa! ko ikakza o pahapahad no anito, tayapiyatao.
S.TRANSL: Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: do dang am na yanan no yamey sina sina oli a pahapahad no anito.
ori am tapipi, beken na pahapahad no anito.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: ji kangey do teymarai, tomo nita dojya!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: noon, namen jyangey do yatey marai.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: makapyaka mangonong, tamalektekka, ji ka malayo.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: ko meybezbez a tomitasya.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: makongo ka mangey do sarowap?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: ko meyyaleleh a mangey do sarowap.
makongo so anjin a mangey do pangavavawan?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: ya malam a mangey do pangavavawan.
makongo ka mangey do pengho?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: ko mavang do sikoki a mangey do pengho.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: makongo ka mangey do pengho?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: ko mavang do avang a mangey do pengho.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: ikongo mo avangan si maika?
ko mavang do avang aya moli.
malap, ikongo mo avangan a mangey meyvatvatek?
S.TRANSL: How does malap go to school?

S.FORM: malap, yako mavang do matolatolang aleleh, a mangey do gako.
S.TRANSL: malap goes to school by train.

S.FORM: omis, ikongo mo avangan a mangey do kyokay?
S.TRANSL: How does omis go to church?

S.FORM: ko o mavang do vaziososen no ai a, aleleh. yamangey do kyokay.
S.TRANSL: omis goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: ka mangonong a yamange do peyvatvatkan?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school on foot?

S.FORM: beken, ko mavang do aleleh.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: ka mey yaleleh a mangey do peyvatvatkan?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: noon, ko mey yaleleh a mangey do peyvatvatkan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: ka mavang do matolatolang a leleh a mangey do takaw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: noon, ko o mavang do matolatolang a leleh a mangey do takaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: si mangey ka do tayto am ka mavang do sikoki?
S.TRANSL: Are you going to Taitung by plane?

S.FORM: ko mavang do sikoki ta yamaksez.
si mangey ka do kyokay am, ka meyyaleleh?
S.TRANSL: Are you going to drive to the church?

S.FORM: ko meyyaleleh a mangey do kyokay.
S.TRANSL: I will drive to the church.

S.FORM: ya masngen o pananazangan do vahey nyo?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: ya jyasngen, ta ko pamey yaleleh a yamangey manazang do pananazangan.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: ya masngen o yobingkyo do peyvatvatkan?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: ko tongalam a yamangey, tayamasngen.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: ya masngen o akakanan do pangapanalan so aleleh?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: alima ka vatvatek o ipangonong ka pakaranesrana.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: ya myan so mo i pey walam?
tangang?
ko naknakmen ko kangey jimo.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: ko jingyan do vahey namen ta yamyan so vazey ko. no maikoan rana.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: ka meywalam si marow, mangey ko jimo si makoyab.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: noon, nanalahen ko imo do vahey namen.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: manngo! apyakapatoong ko sya? ta ko manakem a ya ciloon.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: apya! abokaratan na.
apya sivan ko?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: ko malahet a citahen. taosya.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: ka siva ko jya.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: jimonivai.
ayoi mo kapya jyaken amapacici jimo.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: apya, ikongo o mo ipanahes?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: no kalavayomo am, ikongo minavazey mo?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: minamey kalsong ko, am kona ni omhat.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: ya mya so vazey mo siciaikoa ya?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: ko mya do peyvatvatkan ayameyvazey.
yamya o anakmo do ilinyo?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: beken, yamyan o anak ko do tose aya meyvahey.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: ka sa ka tao aya meyvahey?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: ya myan so ino ko kano lapik, yak mey anak ko.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: ya myan so koza ko, ya myan so o mow malalam ya ko jya menengi.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: ko i panahes jimo. o makanyow do manakep so omowmalalam.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: ya pereh ko katenngan, am ciaha ta tovisan ko imo.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: a myan so makanyow do rayon?
S.TRANSL: 你們飛魚季有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos during the flying fish season?

S.FORM: noon, a myan so makanyow. malotoy am jyangey do vahey no amyan so tatala.
S.TRANSL: 是，我們有飛魚季的禁忌。孕婦不能出去有小船的家屋。
Yes, we have a taboo during the flying fish season. Pregnant women are not allowed to go out to a house with a boat.

S.FORM: tangang?
ta ji makamong so arayo.
S.TRANSL: Because it will make us not able to catch the dolphinfish.

S.FORM: mogaz, yabo rana do vahey ta o saki, mangey kapa manazang.
S.TRANSL: mogaz, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: ya pamyan do panonotongan, ji na manazang!
ya ji makanet o yasa, mangey kapa manazang so adoa.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: ko manazang so saki, yamyan an?
S.TRANSL: I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: yamyan, yapira o mo sazangan?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: ko manazang so yadoa tagow, ka no yasalavat a mojis.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: oya do jya mojis, ya myan pa so mo ikakza?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: ko manazang so icyoi, yamyan do jya?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: da na nimiminani sazangan.
ko manazang so ayob.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: yakman so ajin o mo i kaza?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: ko manazang so ainged so ari lawang.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: manngo o ya mabazangbang eya?
ya mya so ya macitarek?
ya pamyan so ya malavang kano mowgaraw.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: toro mo jyaken o ya mowgaraw.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: molingwan, kani mangey jino no kacitoai ang? ka ni mangey mapazigton?
S.TRANSL: molingwan你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
molingwan, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: beken, ko ni mangey manazang so yakan ni yakes.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: ori i, kameywalam si mahep, a pya ka peyheza ta koman.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: taosya, ta ko mangey manazang so ayob ko.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: macih za ko jimo.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: akokey, apira ngina no yakan?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: yadoa poo.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: yapira ngina no wakey?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: yat loa poo yasa ka naneng.
i panta mo yaken so a doabedbe da yakan, kano asa ka naneng a wakey.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: kanosang, ko niya ow o ipivatvatek a pya ka pa mood ko jimo?
S.TRANSL: kanosang，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
kanosang, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: yabo jyaken, o yam si mangaz.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is mangaz’s.

S.FORM: apya ka vood kopasya, ciaha ta makeykai ko a ma paoli sya jimo.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: noon, aap.
ayoi, i panci mo yaken a ya somarey nya ji mangaz.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank mangaz for me.

S.FORM: yamyan so mo ikakza?
ko paolien o adoa ka vakong.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: noon, ya mya pa so mo ikakza?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: ko mamood so atlo a ka vakong.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: ciana, manakem mo do i katlwarow na, ka paoli mosya.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: mo pa jya nitoro o ipangongopas.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: ni paoli kona no kakyab.
asyo ko na jya kala o ipangongopas.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: a la mo ni pavood ji tanakasang.
S.TRANSL: Maybe you lend it to tanakasang.

S.FORM: ko jyatenngi. mange ko pala i panahes jya.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. If so, let me go and ask her first.

S.FORM: vood pa o ipangongopas ko.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: pozngit, o ayob yaam nani pavood jimo ni yopan?
S.TRANSL: pozngit, did yopan lend you this coat?

S.FORM: beken, nani sazangan ni ina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: yamey yangey o ayob nyo a kani yopan.
S.TRANSL: yopan’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: ya jimey yangey, tamavaheng o ayob na.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: azaon, kani mamood ji mahanang so nizpi?
S.TRANSL: azaon, did you borrow money from mahanang?

S.FORM: yamyan, ko poapaolin siciarow ya am, ko jini manakem o nizpi.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: si mango mo paolin?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: paolin ko jia simarow.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: noon, ipanci ko jia.
alpidan no vato o vavahey no karam a irakep sira.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay.

S.FORM: ori i, ko jyatatenngi, ori ko ji makarakpisya.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: nana o on ko imo a mapakapya so ilita do karam.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up the trap.

S.FORM: noon! yapiya! no mangey ko am makarakep kona so o mawmalalam.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: mangap ka so kekezdas, tamangey ta do orata, yamatamek rana.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: ajin moni payan so kekezdas?
ya myan do katangked no yala, si somdep ka am alilin na cita.
S.TRANSL: 在簍子的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: meypepezat ka, tayamatarem o kekezdas.
S.TRANSL: Be careful. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: ji mo todey zasagi o ko litan do omow malalam.
a ji nayanan no mo panlilitan?
yamyan do teyrahem no kayo.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: moni ma nakem ori?
yamyan so koni singkad jya, ori ko ipakateneng do nayanan.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: oyam ipanakep so a mong, ya pangain do oyo.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: yabo jyamen o manpoy a ipangap so among, tanamen mamasil no pakow yan.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: namen pa jya ni mamasil, sipisa am nanaon mo yaken.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: noon, nosipisi am, meyhezata mamasil.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: no ipisaam nanaon ko imo ma pakapya so pangozongan so among.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: ya mey gonagoney o pakowyan mo, vaozen mo, ta nanyakan no among.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: sitai, tayameygona goney avang, tokong yan jya am ngingit sya.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: a pen mo jya, ta sidongen ko imo am lolo sya.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: yatey ya pyasicirow ya, ni mapno o karey ta no among.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: molitana, kavonong ta sya jira.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: yana mai o sinsi.
jikamna mialilima, lisna kamna do ezsadan.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: akokay, a ya koni mipahaay!
key asdepey.
yana sincici sicyaraw?
sinci 5 sicyaraw, ya miwalam simaraw, miyowyaw ta an!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: noon! mangay ta do pais no ayo.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: ya sincici simaraw?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: sinci 3 simaraw, mibozo ta simakoyab an!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: ikongo vazay mo do pepnezak simaraw?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: niciyo simaraw, yamen mi-ina am, yamangay do kyokay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: ka makongo?
ko akmi ya mowtowta, ko mangay do o bowbotan.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: yama ood oo ko.
pi walam pa.
sinsi, ya meyngen velek ko, mangay do o bowbotan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: noon, angay.
apiya ka pavanaw ko?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: yana makaykai rana miwalam, citai na am mangay ka.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi, ya meyngen oo ko, miwala ko simakoyab.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: noon, makapiya ka mowli do vahay nyo.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: sinsi, miwalam ko simaktey sinci 1, ko mangay do koysang.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: noon, makapiya ka so kataotao.
ajin nayanan niMatnaw?
ya meyngen velek na, ya amyan do obowbotan.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: ajin nayanan niKaswal?
sinsi, yameyngen tetehnan na niKaswal, ya miwalam sicaraw.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kaswal has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: na jini mai niMatnaw?
ya mazidangdang.
ajin monikapoan!
ngaran ko, Si.NGazamo, sicyawan am, ko asangernan so kakawakawan.
S.TRANSL: My name is Si.NGazamo, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: ngaran ko Si.NGazamo.
anak do ajin a yancominco imo?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: anak no tao do pongso ko.
kanyo madadaya saka vahay ya yancomin?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: noon namen mamimin na Tao.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是達悟族。
Yes, my whole family is Yami.

S.FORM: kanyo madadaya saka vahay ya yancomin?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: beken, tao do pongso si.yama, dehdeh si ina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是達悟族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Yami, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: sino anak imo?
anak na yaken snyaman Mangai.
syama mo ito? yana apira kakawakawan na?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: yana anemangernan o kakawaawan na.
syamamo ito? yana pira o kakawakawan na?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: beken, iyam rarakeh do ili namen, yana waongernan so kakawakawan na.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: yana apira kakawakawan nikakamo a meakay?
yana awoa so ikarwangernan o kakawakawan ni kaka a meakay.
ya rako wawang no kakawakawan na jimo nikaka mo a meakay?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: namen alima kakawakawan so awang.
ya apira mo ka karangan?
ko apata angernan asa poo so kakarakarang.
tana mownay jini misinkad, kakmi ya nimipakarang?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: nonan, kona atlo a ngernan asapoo so kakarakarang.
kakmi ya nimipatava?
jyabo, yamalas mo citan sya.
ka nimi pagozang?
jyabo, ko nimi patava.
ka nimi patava?
noon, ya atlo angernan ko karehrehmet.
ka mangay jino?
ko kalaen sinsi do da pivazayan.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: Maomay! kamangay jino?
na mangay pipwa o ibeybek.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: ajin nayanan niMaomay?
ya amyan do mibebneng a pilwawatan, citaina am ya minenenet a milwawat.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: ajin na yanan niMatnaw? citaina am ya minenenet a malalayo.
S.TRANSL: Matnaw在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Matnaw? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: ya amyan do panaralayan dang, mangay ko ipanci siya.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: mikehzata mangay do pialilima an.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: mangay ko pa manazang so kanen do mararaw, citaina am kalaen ko imo.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: mikehzata aviten o kanen ta!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: pikala so tao, ko kalaen sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Maomay yami nenenet manpokpok sicyaaw so bozo?
S.TRANSL: Is Maomay competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: jyabo, ya minenenet mililiktaw.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: simiwondokay am ka mangay minenenet?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: nonan, ko malalayo.
simiwondokay am ka mangay minenenet?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ko minenenet mipopokpok so bozo.
ikongo vazay tamo simiwondokay?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: namen milololo so ovid.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: simiwondokay am mipanazang tamo so kanekanen?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: jabo, namen mipanazang so avyoten a bozo.
kani makahap so icibang, ka teywaraya!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: ayoy.
ya amyan syakes ta do vahay?
ya amyan, yamikeh do vahay.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: ya amyan syakes ta do vahay?
jyabo, na kapa kowbot pa , simaep am nayai.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: ya amyan syakay ta do vahay?
ya amyan do mivava a kadoa no vahay, angaz am kala sya.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: ya amyan tao do vahay?
Kaswal? yana mownay jini macita imo, ka papiya?
S.TRANSL: 是Kaswal阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Kaswal. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: yapiya! ko kalaen imo paciwalaman.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: anjn nayanan niyama mo?
ya amyan do panonotongan mapasisit so yasay, panci ko siya an?
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他，好?
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: ajin na niyangayan ni Matnaw?
ya mangay manakep so manok.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: yakay, mo na nimai
jiabo akay nyo do vahay, ya amyan do akaon, amyan kanyo do vahay mapa nanala siya, an?
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: maran! ka nanimai!
ya mownay jini macita, ka nimipakarang.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: masaray macita imo a nimai.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: o pinapo ya am, ya itoro jinyo, pangay nio do pangarerekmehan.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: ka na mownay jinimai, ko ipanci inyo ya koman.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: jimoa rawtan, to kona ngiyop so cinwat, mangay tamo dosdepan miwalam.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝水就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: ayoy nakem mo jyaken, ko na mangay.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: apen mo paya o manok an, yabo ko itoro jimo.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞給你，沒甚麼東西好送.
Here’s a chicken for you, just a little something.

S.FORM: simaraw do makoyab am misinmota an?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: noon, ajin pisinmoan ta?
mangayta do pivatvatkan an? namen miloin.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: a mangay do kadponponan tao a vahay, a mivinavinayoan ko so mibintebtekan.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去
Then let's go to the community center. I'll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: yapiya citaen do ili namen vonitan a misavong, simisavong rana am , kalaen mo yaken!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的野百合盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: M: simangay rana do amyan sawnam, teymownay rana.
S.TRANSL: 那要等到冬天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It's too late, isn't it?

S.FORM: a simivaci am, mai ka!
S.TRANSL: 那你小米祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: noon! ko kakdain!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I'm looking forward to it!

S.FORM: ko ipaci jimo am, mo ipivahay do ili.
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: ko mangay mapivatvatek.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: a mo jingyani do karowan tao a mapivatvatek?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: noon ta ko ikapaw o pongso namen, inaoy ta masidong ko o ili namen.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: ka mateneng tominon, sino ninanao imo?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You're very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: siyakes, iya am, nimateneng na tominon do ili namen.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: mo pakanakem a ya macinanao do tominon?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: iwawalam namen o cininon ya, ko kakdain iwawalam namen am loslos do malavayo.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: ya maganinam yopen o nipareng a saki.
yaken nipansahadan nang!
ka teywara ya, mownay pansahadan ya?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You're really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ala kapito araw kapiyana rana. panmaen mokis kano kadai dendengen kapangay so odong a kocikoten, kapiyana rana pakozongen do vanga.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: ya amyan so mo ipanazang?
ya amyan ja so tonggazasi kano yasay, madadaya nimoa ko!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和白菜，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and chinese cabbage, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: no adoa sazangan am, apira nginana?
alima ngernan kadoana ranaw no nizpi.
ko ikakza o ayob ya, apira ngernan?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: o ya am, ya alimaranaw.
teymasingat rana, maraet kapapereh pa sya?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: maraet, sipaepepen am, ji ko makanizpi.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: noon na! mangap ko so saka masirema ayob.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: apen ko ipangan ya, kano kama ya.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: mamimin adoa zivo, madadaya niparpareng ko ya, ji moaraetan karaetna.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: sipanci kagagan ko manazang am, paperen mo nizpi?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: noon! cyata paperen ko nizpi na.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I will give you a discount.

S.FORM: aikanyo jya! ya amyan so ayob kano sakop ya ipanazang.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: apira nginana no ayob ya?
saka ayob am, alima ngernan katlona ranaw, no atlo am asa zivo.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: asa sazangan ko, toro jaken vayo.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: akokay, ko kakdain manazang so nidengdeng a kadai a kano nimay
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買小米飯和芋頭糕。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and Taro cake with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: yabo rana o kanen. ya amyan pa o taroy, sazangan mo?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有臘肉，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have bacon, would you like to buy some?

S.FORM: noon! toro asa jyaken, sipisa am manazang ko so kanen.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: noon, pakozongen ko do alavat, o ya am alima poo a ngernan.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
